lead_paragraph: The Indiana Fever hired the assistant Lin Dunn to replace Coach Brian Winters on Wednesday. Dunn, who spent four seasons as a Fever assistant coach, succeeds Winters, who was 78-58 in four seasons and guided the W.N.B.A. team to three playoff appearances. Winters was let go in October with a year left on his contract. Dunn will be the Fever’s fourth coach in their eight-year history. Dunn went 33-63 as the coach and general manager of the expansion Seattle Storm from 1999-2002. With the Storm, she drafted Lauren Jackson, the eventual league most valuable player, and Sue Bird.
